text: Policy Number: TEST-12345
explanation: The element defines the term 'Policy Number' used in the policy.
function: Identifies the unique identifier assigned to the insurance policy.

text: Named Insured: ABC Corporation
explanation: The element defines the term 'Named Insured' as ABC Corporation, specifying who is covered under the policy.
function: Identifies the entity or individual to whom the insurance policy is issued and who is covered under the policy.

text: Policy Period: 01/01/2025 to 01/01/2026
explanation: The element establishes the specific time period during which the policy is in effect, indicating the start and end dates.
function: Defines the duration of coverage provided by the insurance policy.

text: Limits of Insurance: $1,000,000 Each Occurrence
explanation: This element specifies a specific monetary limit of $1,000,000 for each occurrence, which is a sub-limit within the broader coverage provided by the policy.
function: To establish the maximum amount the insurance company will pay for a single occurrence of a covered loss.

text: This endorsement modifies insurance provided under the following: COMMERCIAL GENERAL LIABILITY COVERAGE PART
explanation: This endorsement specifically modifies the insurance provided under the Commercial General Liability Coverage Part, indicating a change or extension of coverage.
function: To specify the alterations or additions to the coverage provided under the Commercial General Liability Coverage Part.

text: SCHEDULE Name of Additional Insured Person(s) Or Organization(s): XYZ Partner Company
explanation: The element specifies the name of an additional insured party, indicating an extension of coverage beyond the named insured. (Corrected invalid type)
function: To extend coverage to a specific entity, in this case, XYZ Partner Company, beyond the primary named insured.

text: Section II – Who Is An Insured is amended to include as an additional insured the person(s) or organization(s) shown in the Schedule.
explanation: The element extends coverage to include additional insured parties as specified in the Schedule.
function: This element expands the scope of coverage to include specific individuals or organizations listed in the Schedule.

text: We will pay those sums that the insured becomes legally obligated to pay as damages because of 'bodily injury' or 'property damage' to which this insurance applies.
explanation: The element provides coverage for damages the insured becomes legally obligated to pay due to bodily injury or property damage.
function: Specifies the scope of coverage provided by the insurance policy.

text: We will have the right and duty to defend the insured against any 'suit' seeking those damages.
explanation: This element provides coverage by granting the insurer the right and duty to defend the insured against any 'suit' seeking damages.
function: To ensure that the insured is protected and represented in legal proceedings related to the policy coverage.

text: However, we will have no duty to defend the insured against any 'suit' seeking damages for 'bodily injury' or 'property damage' to which this insurance does not apply.
explanation: This element explicitly states that the insurer has no duty to defend the insured in certain situations, which falls under the category of exclusions.
function: Excludes coverage for defending the insured in lawsuits for bodily injury or property damage not covered by the policy.

text: The amount we will pay for damages is limited as described in Section III - Limits Of Insurance.
explanation: The element specifies a limit on the amount that will be paid for damages, indicating a sub-limit within the broader coverage.
function: To establish a specific cap on the amount payable for damages under the insurance policy.

text: This insurance applies to 'bodily injury' and 'property damage' only if: (1) The 'bodily injury' or 'property damage' is caused by an 'occurrence' that takes place in the 'coverage territory'; (2) The 'bodily injury' or 'property damage' occurs during the policy period; and (3) Prior to the policy period, no insured listed under Paragraph 1. of Section II – Who Is An Insured and no employee authorized by you to give or receive notice of an 'occurrence' or claim, knew that the 'bodily injury' or 'property damage' had occurred, in whole or in part.

conditions: The 'bodily injury' or 'property damage' is caused by an 'occurrence' that takes place in the 'coverage territory'
The 'bodily injury' or 'property damage' occurs during the policy period
Prior to the policy period, no insured or authorized employee knew that the 'bodily injury' or 'property damage' had occurred

explanation: This element establishes the requirements that must be met for coverage to apply, specifically related to the occurrence, coverage territory, and prior knowledge of the insured.
function: This condition ensures that coverage is only provided for bodily injury and property damage that meet specific criteria related to occurrence location, timing, and prior knowledge.

text:
Expected or Intended Injury
"Bodily injury" or "property damage" expected or intended from the standpoint of the insured.
explanation: The element explicitly removes coverage for bodily injury or property damage that is expected or intended by the insured.
function: To exclude coverage for situations where the insured intentionally causes bodily injury or property damage.

text:
Contractual Liability
"Bodily injury" or "property damage" for which the insured is obligated to pay damages by reason of the assumption of liability in a contract or agreement.
explanation: The element explicitly removes coverage for bodily injury or property damage arising from assumed liability in a contract or agreement.
function: To exclude coverage for liabilities assumed by the insured under contracts or agreements.

text:
Liquor Liability
"Bodily injury" or "property damage" for which any insured may be held liable by reason of:
(a) Causing or contributing to the intoxication of any person;
(b) The furnishing of alcoholic beverages to a person under the legal drinking age or under the influence of alcohol; or
(c) Any statute, ordinance or regulation relating to the sale, gift, distribution or use of alcoholic beverages.
explanation: This element explicitly removes coverage for bodily injury or property damage related to liquor liability situations.
function: Excludes coverage for liabilities arising from the serving of alcohol to individuals under the legal drinking age or already intoxicated.

text: Bodily injury means bodily injury, sickness or disease sustained by a person, including death resulting from any of these at any time.
explanation: The element provides a general definition of 'Bodily injury' as used in the policy.
function: To clarify the scope of bodily injury covered under the policy.

text: Property damage means: a. Physical injury to tangible property, including all resulting loss of use of that property; or b. Loss of use of tangible property that is not physically injured.
explanation: The element provides a specific definition of 'Property Damage' within the policy.
function: To clarify the scope of coverage related to physical injury or loss of use of tangible property

text: Occurrence means an accident, including continuous or repeated exposure to substantially the same general harmful conditions.
explanation: The element provides a definition for the term 'Occurrence' used in the policy.
function: To clarify and specify the meaning of 'Occurrence' within the context of the insurance policy.

text: Coverage territory means: a. The United States of America (including its territories and possessions), Puerto Rico and Canada; b. International waters or airspace, but only if the injury or damage occurs in the course of travel or transportation between any places included in a. above.
explanation: The element defines the geographic scope of coverage, specifying where the insurance policy applies.
function: To clarify the geographical areas where the insurance coverage is valid.

text: Bankruptcy or insolvency of the insured or of the insured's estate will not relieve us of our obligations under this policy.
explanation: This element establishes a requirement that the bankruptcy or insolvency of the insured or their estate will not relieve the insurer of their obligations under the policy.
function: To ensure that the insurer remains obligated to fulfill the terms of the policy even in the event of the insured's bankruptcy or insolvency.

text: You must see to it that we are notified as soon as practicable of an 'occurrence' or an offense which may result in a claim.

conditions: You must see to it that we are notified as soon as practicable of an 'occurrence' or an offense which may result in a claim.

explanation: The element establishes a requirement for the insured to notify the insurer of an 'occurrence' or offense that may result in a claim, indicating a reporting obligation.
function: To ensure timely notification to the insurer of potential claims to allow for proper investigation and handling
